summary: Michelangelo's *David* is an incredible marble statue from the Renaissance era. Standing at over 16 feet tall, it was a groundbreaking work of art when it was created between 1501 and 1504. Originally planned for Florence Cathedral, it was displayed in the city's main square, becoming a symbol of Florence's fight for freedom. The statue depicts the biblical hero David, showcasing his strength and determination. In 1873, *David* was moved to the Galleria dell'Accademia for preservation, with a replica placed in the square.
title: David (Michelangelo)
